info.title: Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion
info.description: Use the Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion API to create and manage ingestion pipelines. OpenSearch Ingestion is a fully managed data collector that delivers real-time log and trace data to OpenSearch Service domains. For more information, see Getting data into your cluster using OpenSearch Ingestion.

servers.description: The Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion multi-region endpoint
The Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion multi-region endpoint
The Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)
The Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion endpoint for China (Beijing) and China (Ningxia)

post.description: Removes one or more tags from an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

parameters.name: arn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline to remove tags from.

delete.description: Deletes an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Deleting Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

parameters.name: PipelineName
parameters.description: The name of the pipeline to delete.

get.description: Retrieves information about an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

allOf.description: The name of the pipeline.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.
The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The current status of the pipeline.
A description of why a pipeline has a certain status.
Information about a pipeline's current status.
The reason for the current status of the pipeline.
The Data Prepper pipeline configuration in YAML format.
The date and time when the pipeline was created.
The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.
The ingestion endpoints for the pipeline, which you can send data to.
Whether logs should be published.
The name of the CloudWatch Logs group to send pipeline logs to. You can specify an existing log group or create a new one. For example, /aws/OpenSearchService/IngestionService/my-pipeline.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This parameter is required if IsLoggingEnabled is set to true.
Container for the values required to configure logging for the pipeline. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Ingestion will not publish logs from your application to CloudWatch Logs.
Key-value pairs that represent log publishing settings.
The unique identifier of the endpoint.
The ID for your VPC. Amazon Web Services PrivateLink generates this value when you create a VPC.
A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoint.
A list of security groups associated with the VPC endpoint.
Options that specify the subnets and security groups for an OpenSearch Ingestion VPC endpoint.
Information about the VPC, including associated subnets and security groups.

items.description: An OpenSearch Ingestion-managed VPC endpoint that will access one or more pipelines.

allOf.description: The VPC interface endpoints that have access to the pipeline.
Information about an existing OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.
Detailed information about the requested pipeline.

parameters.name: PipelineName
parameters.description: The name of the pipeline to get information about.

get.description: Retrieves information about a specific blueprint for OpenSearch Ingestion. Blueprints are templates for the configuration needed for a CreatePipeline request. For more information, see Using blueprints to create a pipeline.

allOf.description: The name of the blueprint.
The YAML configuration of the blueprint.
Container for information about an OpenSearch Ingestion blueprint.
The requested blueprint in YAML format.

parameters.name: BlueprintName
parameters.description: The name of the blueprint to retrieve.

get.description:
Returns progress information for the current change happening on an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. Currently, this operation only returns information when a pipeline is being created.

For more information, see Tracking the status of pipeline creation.

allOf.description: The time at which the configuration change is made on the pipeline.
The overall status of the pipeline configuration change.
The total number of stages required for the pipeline configuration change.
The name of the stage.
The current status of the stage that the change is in.
A description of the stage.
The most recent updated timestamp of the stage.

items.description: Progress details for a specific stage of a pipeline configuration change.

allOf.description: Information about the stages that the pipeline is going through to perform the configuration change.

items.description: The progress details of a pipeline configuration change.

allOf.description: The current status of the change happening on the pipeline.

post.description: Retrieves a list of all available blueprints for Data Prepper. For more information, see Using blueprints to create a pipeline.

allOf.description: The name of the blueprint.

items.description: A summary of an OpenSearch Ingestion blueprint.

allOf.description: A list of available blueprints for Data Prepper.

post.description: Checks whether an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline configuration is valid prior to creation. For more information, see Creating Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

allOf.description: A boolean indicating whether or not the pipeline configuration is valid.
The validation message.

items.description: A validation message associated with a ValidatePipeline request in OpenSearch Ingestion.

allOf.description: A list of errors if the configuration is invalid.

PipelineConfigurationBody.description: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.

post.description: Tags an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Tagging Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

parameters.name: arn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline to tag.

Tags.description: The list of key-value tags to add to the pipeline.

allOf.description: The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the pipeline to which they are attached.

The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity

items.description: A tag (key-value pair) for an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

put.description: Updates an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline. For more information, see Updating Amazon OpenSearch Ingestion pipelines.

allOf.description: The name of the pipeline.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.
The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The current status of the pipeline.
A description of why a pipeline has a certain status.
Information about a pipeline's current status.
The reason for the current status of the pipeline.
The Data Prepper pipeline configuration in YAML format.
The date and time when the pipeline was created.
The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.
The ingestion endpoints for the pipeline, which you can send data to.
Whether logs should be published.
The name of the CloudWatch Logs group to send pipeline logs to. You can specify an existing log group or create a new one. For example, /aws/OpenSearchService/IngestionService/my-pipeline.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This parameter is required if IsLoggingEnabled is set to true.
Container for the values required to configure logging for the pipeline. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Ingestion will not publish logs from your application to CloudWatch Logs.
Key-value pairs that represent log publishing settings.
The unique identifier of the endpoint.
The ID for your VPC. Amazon Web Services PrivateLink generates this value when you create a VPC.
A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoint.
A list of security groups associated with the VPC endpoint.
Options that specify the subnets and security groups for an OpenSearch Ingestion VPC endpoint.
Information about the VPC, including associated subnets and security groups.

allOf.description: The VPC interface endpoints that have access to the pipeline.
Information about an existing OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

MinUnits.description: The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).

MaxUnits.description: The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs)

PipelineConfigurationBody.description: The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.

The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This parameter is required if IsLoggingEnabled is set to true.

PipelineBlueprintSummary.description: A summary of an OpenSearch Ingestion blueprint.

allOf.description: The current status of the pipeline.
A description of why a pipeline has a certain status.

StatusReason.description: Information about a pipeline's current status.

allOf.description: The name of the pipeline.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the pipeline.
The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The date and time when the pipeline was created.
The date and time when the pipeline was last updated.

PipelineSummary.description: Summary information for an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

allOf.description: The tag key. Tag keys must be unique for the pipeline to which they are attached.

The value assigned to the corresponding tag key. Tag values can be null and don't have to be unique in a tag set. For example, you can have a key value pair in a tag set of project : Trinity and cost-center : Trinity

items.description: A tag (key-value pair) for an OpenSearch Ingestion pipeline.

allOf.description: The list of key-value tags to add to the pipeline.
The tag keys to remove.
The minimum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs).
The maximum pipeline capacity, in Ingestion Compute Units (ICUs)

The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.
Whether logs should be published.
The name of the CloudWatch Logs group to send pipeline logs to. You can specify an existing log group or create a new one. For example, /aws/OpenSearchService/IngestionService/my-pipeline.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch.
The destination for OpenSearch Ingestion logs sent to Amazon CloudWatch Logs. This parameter is required if IsLoggingEnabled is set to true.
Container for the values required to configure logging for the pipeline. If you don't specify these values, OpenSearch Ingestion will not publish logs from your application to CloudWatch Logs.
Key-value pairs to configure log publishing.

The pipeline configuration in YAML format. The command accepts the pipeline configuration as a string or within a .yaml file. If you provide the configuration as a string, each new line must be escaped with \n.
The validation message.

items.description: A validation message associated with a ValidatePipeline request in OpenSearch Ingestion.

allOf.description: The validation message.

ValidationMessage.description: A validation message associated with a ValidatePipeline request in OpenSearch Ingestion.

allOf.description: The unique identifier of the endpoint.
The ID for your VPC. Amazon Web Services PrivateLink generates this value when you create a VPC.
A list of subnet IDs associated with the VPC endpoint.
A list of security groups associated with the VPC endpoint.
Options that specify the subnets and security groups for an OpenSearch Ingestion VPC endpoint.
Information about the VPC, including associated subnets and security groups.

VpcEndpoint.description: An OpenSearch Ingestion-managed VPC endpoint that will access one or more pipelines.
